channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Long Delayed Siri Functions Are Reportedly Being Delayed Once Again Because They’re Slow and Inaccurate
item.description: Hey Siri, wake me up when Apple finally fixes you like it's been promising to.

item.title: As someone who's been playing fighting games for over a decade, these are the fight sticks I recommend for when a standard controller just won't cut it
item.description: Looking to get into fighting games? These are the fight sticks I would recommend for beginners from 8BitDo, Hori, and more.

item.title: Claude desktop extension can be hijacked to send out malware by a simple Google Calendar event
item.description: AI assistants apparently can't distinguish between instructions and data, and that is at the center of many zero-click prompt injection attacks.

item.title: Disney just shut down AI image prompts for its characters — and it might mark the end of the Wild West era of AI image creation
item.description: Google has begun restricting Disney-related AI prompts after a legal warning from Disney, reshaping what users can create with Gemini and Nano Banana

item.title: The Animal Crossing New Horizons’ Switch 2 upgrade has brought me back to the island paradise for the first time since COVID — and boy, is it a different game now
item.description: ACNH is a much worse experience when I’m the only person in my friend group playing it.

item.title: 'It is much more than showing pictures of animals. It is about evoking emotion' — how these stunning photos of rare Iberian Lynx converted a hunter into a photographer
item.description: Professional photographer Alexandra Surkova reveals her fascinating journey into wildlife photography, and her passion of photographing Iberian Lynx.

item.title: ‘We’ll Find the Remnants of Ancient Alien Civilizations’: Read Musk’s Gibberish Rant from His xAI All-Hands Meeting
item.description: "I really wanna see the mass driver on the moon that is shooting AI satellites into deep space. Just going like 'shoom, shoom,' just one after the other."
